segments.text: Hi , I am so glad to see you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Are you kidding me ? Why do you say so ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You know , I'm about to graduate and I have to look for a job as soon as possible . But I haven ’ t the faintest idea of how to go about finding a job .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: OK . Let me see where to start .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I guess first I should prepare a resume , right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . You should include your name , address and phone number in your resume .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Then what else should I put into my resume ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Your job objectives , of course . In other words , what kind of job are you searching for ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I got it . Then I should mention my educating background and working experience , should I ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . And don't forget to list them by date . Besides , you should begin with the most recent and then move backward .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Is that all there is to it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , it's also necessary to list a few related interests that are in some way connected to the jobs you want to take .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , good point . You mean here I should show off my special skills and talents to impress the boss .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You said it . At last you ’ d better attach a list of references to your resume .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And one more thing , smile widely .
segments.speaker: S2
